name: Ikies - Traditional Houses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the best hotel/B&B I have ever stayed at. The property itself was actually better than it appeared on the website-and that never happens. This was our honeymoon and ikies made it a memorable one. Every suite was unique-and I think I visited every one. Best of all was the staff. The manager of the property went out of her way to make us feel at home and I will never forget the service she provided. Even beyond her, the staff was courteous, prompt and polite.
reviews.title: outstanding

likes.liked: — the uniqueness of the rooms and view along with the staff
likes.disliked: — nothing-this was the perfect place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this property to anyone visiting Santorini. In fact, I would return to the island just to stay at ikies!
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Santorini

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 4 nights in the Artisan's House in April for a romantic getaway. I had very high expectations based on TA reviews and the photos on their website, and they exceeded every one. We could not have been happier with our stay.
reviews.title: we LOVED ikies!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eleni and the staff were fantastic, and really go out of their way to assist in any way they can. Booking was quick and easy through their website-- Eleni responded very quickly to my inquiry, and contacted us again before our stay to arrange a taxi for us.
reviews.title: Perfect
Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: Breakfast was among the best we've ever had in a hotel, and enjoying it on our terrace with the amazing caldera view can't be beat. The bed was heavenly, and the room the perfect size for us. The small touches-- the bottle of wine on arrival, candles on the edge of the hot tub at night, etc-- really make a stay special, and Ikies excelled at taking the extra step.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A jaw dropping view of the caldera, with an unobstructed sunset view, a very accomodating and hospitable staff , a custom made breakfast by the balcony, a very clean, big comfortable cave-like traditional houses, fluffy pilows,yummy chocolates on your bed after sunset,a warm jacuzzi pool, white washed dome shaped cave houses.........that's IKIES. This is one place in Europe which we will be visiting over and over again till we are old and gray. Thank you IKIEs (especially to the manager, Ms. katerina and Ms. Louella) for making our honeymoon a unique and an unforgettable experience.
reviews.title: Will definitely return to IKIES over and over again

likes.liked: — Location,IKIES staff, view, food, jacuzzi pool, robes, towels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ikies gives each of their rooms’ names, so it makes it easy to remember and describe. We had the wonderful opportunity of staying in the “House of the Antiquarian” for our honeymoon for five nights and wish it had been much longer. First of all, Oia is such a perfect place for a honeymoon or romantic adventure. The village is small and quiet, with several restaurants serving great food. Almost every hotel has great views of the Caldera, but care should be taken in choosing the right hotel since many are quite expensive. While many visitors on the island have to go to the end of the island to see the sunset, we could enjoy sunsets directly from our patio, and the moonrises were equally breathtaking.
reviews.title: Terrific Honeymoon Hotel!

likes.disliked: — A little more variety for breakfast.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.text: With that being said, I have stayed in many hotels, but I have never stayed anywhere that has the spectacular view, great amenities, helpful staff, or management that has such incredible attention to detail, as the Ikies Traditional Houses. Because I had read so many great reviews about Ikies, I was quite excited about the prospect of getting to see what everyone was talking about, and Ikies met and exceeded every expectation we could have possibly had. They spoiled us on every level!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: The huge patio with the double chaise lounge was really cool for honeymooners, as was the private Jacuzzi, which we thoroughly enjoyed. Our particular room had a laptop computer, stereo, a DVD player, and free DVDs available for checkout in the office. Each day, they not only brought our breakfast, but also sat it out on our patio table like a restaurant. No normal room service here! Their suggestions for restaurants and help arranging a rental car and securing a reservation for our sailboat cruise were all great! This hotel is worth every penny spent, and I would rate it six stars, if that were possible.
reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing place

likes.liked: — The view, the room, the breakfast, the outdoor jacuzzi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ikies from June 20 - June 25 in the Winemaker's room. Everything about the stay was flawless. Eleni and Katerina could not have been more helpful in arranging activities and seeing that we were well taken care of. The location of Ikies is breathtaking, and the room was perfect.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel: There is very little that is original to add to the praise for Ikies, but I can't stop myself from trying. We stayed in the House of the Boatman the first 5 nights of our honeymoon--May 28-June 2. Although the Boatman is not big, it is a nice size, sufficient for 2, and it's really all about the large and beautiful terrace, private hot tub, and amazing views. We luxuriated in our hot tub at night and enjoyed the delicious and plentiful breakfast served to us on our balcony each day. Like some others who've reviewed the hotel, we would save a portion of breakfast each day for a satisfying afternoon snack-perfect! The walk to Oia was not too close and not too far -- just right for building up an appetite.
reviews.title: Another rose for Ikies

likes.liked: — The staff, the views, the balcony, the breakfast
likes.disliked: — The cats--but they are everywhere in Greece

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff: While there are several hotels near Ikies on the outskirts of Oia that must have similarly lovely views, it is hard to imagine that any has such a genuinely warm and welcoming staff as Ikies does. Eleni, Loella, and the others made us feel so at home and took great care of us. I have stayed at many hotels and never encountered another staff such as there is at Ikies. Many thanks, Eleni et al!
reviews.title: A Postcard of a Honeymoon!

likes.liked: — The view from any room, the value, the room itself, the manager and so on and so on...
likes.disliked: — That it isn't my permanent residence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of notes: The mezede platter at Ikies is delicious (especially the octopus) and plenty of food if you are too tired to go out. Ambrosia was wonderful and romantic for dinner out (get the smoked eel appetizer). Sigalas Winery, which is not far and which provides the wine Ikies gives you upon arrival, had the most lovely wine tasting, peaceful setting, and wonderful snacks you could order and enjoy with the wine. Take the boat trip and climb the volcano. And make plans to come back to Santorini and Ikies soon.
reviews.title: We loved Ikies!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So between my new husband and I, we ARE travelers! And working and traveling with celebrtities in the past, I have seen some AMAZING places to stay. This place is beyond all that I have ever experienced. From the minute my husband and I arrived for our honeymoon, we were greeted with kind staff taking our bags down to our room from the parking lot (yes, there are steps, although very few..and I felt bad that I packed heavy!) But for them, it didn't seem to matter... We stayed in the Fisherman's House one night and the rest at the Carpenter's House. Walking into both rooms came a breathless gasp of "WOW" out of us as we were in awe of the beauty of the rooms and the attention to detail. Everything was clean, airy and BEAUTIFUL. The view from the rooms was like waking up to a postcard everyday. We couldn't have asked for a more romantic place to stay. They provide you with various CD's to play in the rooms to set the mood; there are candles everywhere to light and in the honeymoon suite they provide a laptop for you to use - can't get better than that. Oh, yes, it's free!
reviews.title: Words just can't describe it... you have to see it for yourself!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: At one point during our stay, while enjoying our view we could hear our neighbors gasp upon seeing their room. Trust me, it was because they were in awe that they were loud in that one moment because you could not hear a peep from anyone at any other time. It is a quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle that is in Fira and we were happy to have Eleni (the most amazing hotel manager EVER!) set up a car rental for us and dinner reservations to the best places to eat in town.
reviews.title: Best place in Santorini

likes.liked: — Huge deck overlooking caldera, great service
likes.disliked: — cold coffee, staff constantly walking past even early in morning, bad mattress, floors not cleaned during our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't really say anything that hasn't been said by the review immediately preceeding mine...other than I agree entirely.
reviews.title: Ditto. Ikies is beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oia is beautiful and unless you are looking to be right in the middle of a busy (read, slightly dirty and rundown), small city, I wouldn't recommend Fira. As many guide books suggest, go to Fira for some action, stay in Oia. It doesn't take long to figure out how to navigate Santorini, so exploring the entire island is possible from any of the towns you may choose to stay.
reviews.title: perfect stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the hotels in Oia have nice views, so I imagine it is service and cleanlyness that really matter when choosing one. The staff at Ikies was super friendly, accomodating and ready to help you do anything it is that you wanted to accomplish. Which is probably sit on your balcony and take in the fact that you picked the perfect spot to spend your holiday.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ikies is a little piece of heaven overlooking the whitewashed village of Oia. Words can't describe what a wonderful place this is, they have thought of everything to make your stay out of this worls. The staff are fantastic and nothing is too much trouble. This is a place for couples to enjoy themselves and relax, make sure you book a room with a jacuzzi. Worth every penny!
reviews.title: Beautiful, breathtaking and brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can not imagine a hotel could have this good service. Every whim of mine was catered to. For example if the hot tub was too hot they came immediately and added cold water. When I said my pillow was too big they exchanged it for a softer pillow. Soda water was delivered with lemon and ice within two minutes of asking.
reviews.title: beautiful views with superb service

likes.disliked: — the number of stairs to reach your apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The private hot tub had an amazing view. Breakfast was served in your private terrace right over the caldera with white tablecloth and flowers and more food than you could possible eat. A perfect retreat and setting
reviews.title: Extraordinary

likes.liked: — It was unique . Completely up to date, yet serene and quietly beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dear Trippers,
reviews.title: One of the most perfect holidays ever

likes.disliked: — Swimming pool is a bit small, and lots of steps (inevitable in Oia!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel through TripAdvisor and I booked it
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon Experience!

likes.disliked: — There is nothing to not like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ikies for three nights in mid-September and it was the highlight of our two-week trip to Greece. Something about waking up in the morning, opening the bright blue doors of your cozy room to views of the sparkling Aegean, and being served a wonderful breakfast right on our patio .... it was heavenly!
reviews.title: Ikies is wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the House of the Fisherman and loved it. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom had a great shower and all the amenities we needed, and the overall decor was great. The staff were always so friendly and helpful and gave great tips for exploring the island. We can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Most Amazing Little Hotel I've Ever Stayed In!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon and were lucky enough to find Ikies. I cant say enough good things about this small hotel. It only has 11 suites, and it therefore has an extremely intimate feel.
reviews.title: Ikies - fabulous hotel and service

likes.liked: — everything: large terrace with hot-tub, incredible view, privacy, large room with separate living - dining area, bathroom with separate shower, steam room, jacuzzi, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a wonderful location in Ia. We felt this was by far the nicest part of the island, and its very easy to walk to many places. The hotel is gorgeous - with the most incredible views of the sea and of Ia. The best part of the hotel is definitely the staff. Its so personal because its so small, and each and every person on the staff is a nice, sweet, and helpful as can be. We got stuck on a ferry and ended up at the hotel a day late, and we didnt get charged for the room despite have booked it months in advance. Now thats outstanding customer service.
reviews.title: The Perfect Honeymoon

likes.liked: — The amazing terrace with jacuzzi plunge pool
likes.disliked: — The comfort of the bed (it's a bit lumpy)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts are incredible too. I am still dreaming about the chocolate chip muffins - but the setting and the service cant be topped. The pool is pleasant, the rooms are nice and spacious (we were in the fisherman's suite). The bathrooms were lovely too. :)
reviews.title: World-class luxuries with homey hospitality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days in October and loved every minute of it. I had been to Santorini once before and this hotel, along with my wife's company, made my second visit even better than the first. The hotel itself is beautiful - great view, great location. We stayed in both the Sailor's House and the Boatman's House, both were excellent. The rooms were clean and had nice amenities, including a welcome bottle of wine and water already chilled on arrival.
reviews.title: Should be #1

likes.liked: — Hard to say, great all around experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and very helpful. For starters they helped us get a rental car less than 1 hour after we requested it. They tried to accommodate every request we made. As a gift to our first child (my wife was 5 months pregnant at the time), they allowed us to upgrade to the Boatman's House so we could use the private hot tub on the balcony. They had great recommendations for restaurants, particularly the one in Amoudi. All in all the staff made a visit with some spotty weather a fairly spotless experience. When we had to leave very early on our last day there, the bellman was there at 5:30 am to help carry our bags up the steps in the cold rain.
reviews.title: Most incredible hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about traveling to Santorini. In fact, I think if you are in Greece at all you should go out of your way to visit this place, the experience was that good. The only caveat would be that with the low retaining walls it is probably not the best place for a trip with small children. Other than that, I think this is probably the best value I have ever experienced in a hotel anywhere.
reviews.title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To the staff at Ikies - Thanks for making our stay a memorable one - we'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jason & Lexie
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We honeymooned there in April and I still get a bit teary-eyed looking at pictures of the Carpenter's Suite, where we stayed! What an amazing room and what a wonderful trip. We went there based on the reviews on this site (try finding a bad one!) and, as everyone said, Eleni and the staff were amazing. I loved that they were waiting for us in the parking lot when we got there and greeted us like long lost friends. They know the perfect balance between going above and beyond and acting obsequious....I have stayed in many luxury hotels, but I have never, ever had service like this. I don't return to places or hotels often but we are hoping to visit Ikies over and over again. There cannot be a better place to stay in Oia. You are missing out if you don't stay here!
reviews.title: My favorite hotell of all-time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Ikies for two weeks for our honeymoon in June and July 2007. We had an incredible time! We stayed in the House of the Winemaker and the views from our terrace were amazing! The champagne breakfast every morning, the cocktails at sunset and the incredible service (if you want anything just dial 100, they'll even make the water in your hot tub cold if you want to use it as a plunge pool!) made our honeymoon and we couldn't have asked for more.
reviews.title: Thank you Ikies!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eleni and the staff looked after us brilliantly, advising us which restaurants to go to (Ambrosia and Ambrosia & Nectar are a must if you go!), which trips to go on and booking them all for us!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we were delayed on our flight out they even called us whilst we were stuck at Gatwick to let us know that they had seen our flight would be delayed and they would make sure the taxi would be waiting for us whatever time our plane landed!
reviews.title: Amazing experience - will go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Eleni and all the staff for a wonderful stay! I can't recommend Ikies highly enough!
reviews.title: Sheer perfection Kim & Dave, London UK

description: Ikies Traditional Houses is a special type of hotel. Its small size, exceptional location, traditional design, range of accommodation (honeymoon, maisonettes, and studios) and professional operation result in a rare blend of intimate and personalized service offered against a setting of unique physical beauty. Located at the edge of the picturesque village of Oia in the northern part of Santorini and with commanding views over it, into the caldera and of the surrounding Cycladic Greek islands, our guests at Ikies quickly tune themselves into the complete tranquility of the romantic village.
